info.name: Courting
info.attribution:
The game room, card design, and game layout are by LawDawg and are released to the Public Domain under CC0.

The castle background is from https://pixabay.com/photos/castle-room-window-ballroom-pomp-1998435/ and is available under the Pixabay license.

The characters on the cards are in the Public Domain and are available as follows:

Assassin: https://openclipart.org/detail/271017/shakespeare-characters-murderer-colour
Jester: https://openclipart.org/detail/271097/shakespeare-characters-jester-colour
Guard: https://openclipart.org/detail/271103/shakespeare-characters-guardsman-colour
Priest: https://openclipart.org/detail/270991/shakespeare-characters-priest-colour
Cardinal: https://openclipart.org/detail/271019/shakespeare-characters-montecci-colour
Baron: https://openclipart.org/detail/271154/shakespeare-characters-cornely-colour
Baroness: https://openclipart.org/detail/270994/shakespeare-characters-olivia-colour
Handmaid: https://openclipart.org/detail/271004/shakespeare-characters-wet-nurse-colour
Sycophant: https://openclipart.org/detail/271153/shakespeare-characters-courier-colour
Prince: https://openclipart.org/detail/271163/shakespeare-characters-benvolio-colour
Count: https://openclipart.org/detail/271108/shakespeare-characters-falstaff-colour
King: https://openclipart.org/detail/271158/shakespeare-characters-french-king-colour
Constable: https://openclipart.org/detail/271054/shakespeare-characters-cassio-colour
Countess: https://openclipart.org/detail/271099/shakespeare-characters-hero-colour
Queen: https://openclipart.org/detail/271104/shakespeare-characters-gertrude-colour
Princess: https://openclipart.org/detail/271007/shakespeare-characters-princess-colour
Bishop: https://openclipart.org/detail/271057/shakespeare-characters-kent-colour

The frame on the cards is from https://pixabay.com/illustrations/frame-ornate-gold-vintage-portrait-1210509/ and is available under the Pixabay license.

The card back design is by LawDawg and is released to the Public Domain under CC0. The images on the card back are from the sources listed above.
info.description: Start with one card. Then draw a card and play a card. Use card powers to expose others and knock them out of the game. First player to win designated number of rounds (4-7 based on number of players) wins.
info.helpText: Players take seats. 2-4 players use original deck and 5-8 players use premium deck. Deck sorting and initial card distribution is done automatically based on number of players in seats. For 2 player version, the 3 extra cards are dealt where seat 8 would be. Press play button to start. During play, if another play is allowed to see your hand, press "Send Peek" button. The viewing player will press the appropriate "Start Peek" then "Stop Peek" button. Manually drag card(s) back to your hand. After round is over, manually adjust scores to show affection tokens won. Manually adjust next starting player using "Turn +1" button. Press "Next Round" button.

1Guard.title: Guard
1Guard.power: Name number other than 1 and name a player. If that player has that card, they are out of the round.

2Priest.title: Priest
2Priest.power: Name another player. Look at their hand.

3Baron.title: Baron
3Baron.power: Name another player and secretly compare hands. The player with the lower value is out of the round.

4Handmaid.title: Handmaid
4Handmaid.power: Until your next turn, ignore all effects from other players cards.

5Prince.title: Prince
5Prince.power: Name any player (including yourself) to discard hand and draw a new card.

6King.title: King
6King.power: Trade hands with another player of your choice.

7Countess.title: Countess
7Countess.power: If you have this card and the King or Prince in your hand, you must discard this card.

8Princess.title: Princess
8Princess.power: If you discard this card, you are out of the round.

0Assassin.title: Assassin
0Assassin.power: If you have this card in hand when another player with a Guard chooses you, they are knocked out of the round and not you. Discard this card and draw a new one.

0Jester.title: Jester
0Jester.power: Name another player. If they win this round, you gain an affection token.

2Cardinal.title: Cardinal
2Cardinal.power: Name any two players (including yourself) to trade hands. You look at one of their hands.

3Baroness.title: Baroness
3Baroness.power: Name one or two other players. Look at their hands.

4Sycophant.title: Sycophant
4Sycophant.power: Name any player (including yourself). If the next card played requires one or more players to be chosen, they must be one of them.

5Count.title: Count
5Count.power: If this card is in your discard pile at end of round, add 1 to the number of the card in your hand. Resolve ties normally.

6Constable.title: Constable
6Constable.power: If this card is in your discard pile when you are knocked out of the round, gain an affection token.

7Queen.title: Queen
7Queen.power: Name another player and secretly compare hands. The player with the higher value is out of the round.

9Bishop.title: Bishop
9Bishop.power: Name number other than 1 and name another player. If they have that number, gain an affection token. They may discard hand and draw new card. Princess beats Bishop at end of round.

fields.text: You are about to recall the cards and start the next round. Are you sure?  You should already have adjusted the scores to reflect the player(s) that won affection tokens. Don't forget to use the 'Turn +1' button to manually adjust the turn indicator to the player who starts the next round.
You are about to reset the game. Are you sure?

extraCardBtn.text: If needed due to action of Assassin or Prince, press this button to retrieve extra card removed at start. Otherwise, score round, adjust turn, and press 'Next Round' button below.
